trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides methods for creating, manipulating, searching, and sorting arrays, thereby serving as the base class for all arrays in the common language runtime.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of elements contained in the collection.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index of the element to get or set.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The element at the specified index.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The starting index of the range to search.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the range to search.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The object to search for.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index of the specified value in the specified array, if value is found; otherwise, a negative number.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ x xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: If value is not found and value is less than one or more elements in array, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than value.
trans-unit.target: Xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxxx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source: If value is not found and value is greater than all elements in array, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1).
trans-unit.target: Xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxxx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx $xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx 0$.

trans-unit.source:
If this method is called with a non-sorted array, the return value can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if value is present in array.

\n
